content.description: Start on large flat hold, grab an obvious, sculpted pinch, and use one of many methods to hit the sloping lip. Throw a high heel, and get yourself on top of the perfectly flat and clean slab. CLASSIC.  Dave Graham added a sit, which bumps grade to V11.
content.location: Currently, this is the only clean line on Magic Bean Boulder.

content.description:
Climb the right, slopey arete of the boulder from a squat start.

 A full sit might go when cold.
content.location: It ascends the sloping right arete with big slopes and funkiness.

content.description: On the left side of the Magic Bean Boulder lies a series of sloping slots. This is A Love Supreme. Start in the lowest slot and climb sloping pinches and crimps to reach a very tough lip encounter. Mount the lip by grabbing horrendous sloping crystal knobs, somehow finding a way to pull your whole body over. If it was a little taller it would be awesome. It's pretty good as is.
content.location: 20-30 feet left of Press Your Luck, on the Magic Bean Boulder.

content.description: This is a mossier version of the Sleeping Giant Boulder. With a little work, it could be exceptional! The rock forms some of the coolest holds around, and with a little scrubbing, there are 3 or so more existing climbs, including a very hard, dynamic, project.
